etymology.description: 崾岘 (yǎoxiàn, "Yaoxian") is a place name that consists of 崾(崾) (yǎo, "high and steep") and 岘(岘) (xiàn, "ridge; peak"). This combination likely refers to a location characterized by high and steep terrain, typical of many place names that describe geographical features in Chinese.
etymology.interpretation: 崾(崾) (yǎo, "high and steep") and 岘(岘) (xiàn, "ridge; peak") combine to describe a location with prominent and steep geographical features, suggesting a rugged landscape.

examples.chinese: 我计划明年去崾岘(崾峴)旅行。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ jìhuà míngnián qù yǎoxiàn lǚxíng.
examples.english: I plan to travel to Yaoxian next year.

examples.chinese: 崾岘被誉为美丽的古镇(崾峴被譽為美麗的古鎮)，吸引了许多游客(吸引了許多遊客)。
examples.pinyin: Yǎoxiàn bèi yù wéi měilì de gǔzhèn, xīyǐnle xǔduō yóukè.
examples.english: Yaoxian is acclaimed as a beautiful ancient town, attracting many tourists.

examples.chinese: 传说中(傳說中)，崾岘藏有仙泉(崾峴藏有仙泉)。
examples.pinyin: Chuánshuō zhōng, yǎoxiàn cáng yǒu xiānquán.
examples.english: According to legend, Yaoxian hides a fairy spring.
